property.name: description
property.value: Contacts (boundaries) of the full spatial extent of Australia's geological provinces. Where possible, the contacts of provinces have been attributed with information about the source, accuracy, and observation method of those lines.

property.name: description
property.value: Descriptions and spatial extents of metallogenic provinces of the Australian continent.

property.name: description
property.value: Descriptions and spatial extents of Cenozoic sedimentary basins of the Australian continent and offshore surrounds. The full 2D spatial extent of provinces (ie, including the extent of a province under any overlying cover material) has been captured.

property.name: description
property.value: The Australian Crustal Elements data layer delineates major upper crustal elements, primarily based on composite geophysical domains, each of which shows a distinctive pattern of magnetic and gravity anomalies. These elements generally relate to older basement, rather than the younger sedimentary basins.

property.name: description
property.value: Descriptions and spatial extents of the fundamental geological elements of the Australian continent and offshore surrounds. Province types include sedimentary basins, tectonic provinces such as cratons and orogens, igneous provinces, and metallogenic provinces. The full 2D spatial extent (ie, including the extent of a province under any overlying cover material) of provinces has been captured.

property.name: description
property.value: This is the parent datafile of a datset that comprises a set of 14+ geoscience products made up of mosaiced ASTER scenes across Australia.

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B7Blue is well ordered kaolinite, Al-rich muscovite/illite, paragonite, pyrophyllite Red is Al-poor (Si-rich) muscovite (phengite)

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B4Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B1/B4Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance(potentially includes carbon black (e.g. ash), magnetite, Mn oxides, and sulphides in unoxidised envornments

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B4/B3Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B6+B8)/B7Blue is low content, Red is high content(potentially includes: chlorite, epidote, jarosite, nontronite, gibbsite, gypsum, opal-chalcedony)

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B2/B1Blue-cyan is goethite rich, Green is hematite-goethite, Red-yellow is hematite-rich

property.name: description
property.value: B6/B5(potential includes: pyrophyllite, alunite, well-ordered kaolinite)Blue is low content, Red is high content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B11/(B10+B12)Blue is low quartz contentRed is high quartz content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B6+B9/(B7+B8)Blue is low content, Red is high content(potentially includes: calcite, dolomite, magnesite, chlorite, epidote, amphibole, talc, serpentine)

property.name: description
property.value: Band ratio: B3/B2 Blue is low contentRed is high content

property.name: name
property.value: ASTER Map Ferrous iron content in MgOH/carbonate

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B4Blue is low ferrous iron content in carbonate and MgOH minerals like talc and tremolite.Red is high ferrous iron content in carbonate and MgOH minerals like chlorite and actinolite.

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B7/B8Blue-cyan is magnesite-dolomite, amphibole, chlorite\tRed is calcite, epidote, amphibole

property.name: description
property.value: 1. False colour RGB composite Red: B3Green: B2Blue: B1(red = green vegetation)

property.name: description
property.value: 1. 3 band RGB composite Red: B3/B2Green: B3/B7Blue: B4/B7(white = green vegetation)

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B5+B7)/B6Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance potentially includes: phengite, muscovite, paragonite, lepidolite, illite, brammalite, montmorillonite, beidellite, kaolinite, dickite

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B10+B12)/B11Blue is low gypsum contentRed is high gypsum content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B13/B10Blue is low silica contentRed is high silica content(potentially includes Si-rich minerals, such as quartz, feldspars, Al-clays)

property.value: Onshore and Offshore Gravity Anomaly Geodetic

property.name: description
property.value: This grid combines merged magnetic anomaly data from onshore and offshore WA. It is generated from Federal and State government data sets acquired with a line spacing of 500 metres or less and over 800 open file Company data sets at various line spacings

property.name: group
property.value: Analytic - Geological Survey of Western Australia

property.value: This radioelement grid is generated from Federal and State government data sets acquired with a line spacing of 500 metres or less and selected open file data sets.

property.value: This radioelement grid is generated from Federal and State government data sets acquired with a line spacing of 500 metres or less and selected open file data sets.

property.name: group
property.value: Analytic - Geological Survey of Western Australia

property.name: description
property.value: Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by lithostratigraphic classification, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS_GA_1M_GUPoly_Age (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by age, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS_GA_1M_GUPoly_Lithology (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by lithology, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000.

property.name: name
property.value: 1:1M Surface Geology - contacts, faults, marker beds

property.name: description
property.value: This layer contains lines that complement the geology data, but are not classified as geological features (eg, coastline and other water boundaries, limits of mapping or available data), compiled at 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Faults and Shears (Fault and shear structures, represented as lines, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Contacts (Lines that represent contacts between geological units (eg, depositional, intrusive and faulted contacts), compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Geological Unit Lines (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop) that are too narrow to be represented by polygons, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000.

property.name: description
property.value: Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by lithostratigraphic classification, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS_GA_1M_GUPoly_Age (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by age, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS_GA_1M_GUPoly_Lithology (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop bedrock and surficial regolith units) symbolised by lithology, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000.

property.name: description
property.value: This layer contains lines that complement the geology data, but are not classified as geological features (eg, coastline and other water boundaries, limits of mapping or available data), compiled at 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Faults and Shears (Fault and shear structures, represented as lines, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Contacts (Lines that represent contacts between geological units (eg, depositional, intrusive and faulted contacts), compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000), AUS GA 1:1M Geological Unit Lines (Surface geological units (outcrop or near-outcrop) that are too narrow to be represented by polygons, compiled for use around 1:1M scale. This layer is limited to display only at scales greater than 1:1,500,000.

property.name: description
property.value: The National Onshore Oil Pipelines Dataset represents the spatial locations of pipelines for the transmission of natural Oil within mainland Australia complimented with feature attribution.

property.name: description
property.value: The National Onshore Gas Pipelines Dataset represents the spatial locations of pipelines for the transmission of natural gas within mainland Australia complimented with feature attribution.

property.name: description
property.value: This point dataset contains major ports in Australian waters that include infrastructure facilities where maritime vessels have the ability to load and unload commodities.
